Request A New Font

If the font desired for a specific athlete is not available among the list in the theme settings, follow the below to aquire and submit a new font.

  • 1. Search & download the .ttf version of the font online.
  • 2. Convert the .ttf version of the font to a .otf version (use everythingfonts.com/ttf-to-otf
  • 3. Submit .otf to the developers

Create A Newsletter

When a new athlete is created, a new newsletter key must be generated. To do this, follow the steps below:

  • 1. Log into Sendy: Sendy Link
  • 2. Add a new Brand for the new athlete. Enter in the "New Brand" information like so, ignoring all other settings input.
  • 3. Select "New Athlete" from the Brand list, and then select "View all lists" form the left hand navigation.
  • 4. Add a New list title "Newsletter". One added, select "View all lists" again from the left hand navigation to view the newsletter ID
  • 5. Copy the ID field for the newsletter, and paste this in the Sendy field for the athlete.

Gallery & Video Uploads

Gallery

To create a gallery/galleries for a new athlete:

  • 1. Log into Flickr and navigate to the Photostream option.
  • 2. Create a New Album
  • 3. Give the New Album the Athlete Name and drag the images into the album
  • 4. Once the album is created, select "Batch Edit" and give every image a very unique ID tag.
  • 5. To add the gallery onto the website, navigate to the backend and create the page "Me" (or whatever gallery is relevant). In the "Content" box, select the "<>" tags for html, and paste in the following code: photos_public.gne?id=125473693@N07&tags=yourtaghere by replacing "yourtaghere" with the tag given to the photos.
  • 6. To select the cover photo, upload an image that is 900x600 to photobucket and provide developers with the image link

Video

To create a video gallery for a new athlete:

  • 1. Log into Vimeo and upload the athlete video
  • 2. Select Done and Go to Video
  • 3. Scroll down and add in the domain information for the video's settings.
  • 4. Select the Embed option for the video. On this page, select the Preset dropdown and set it to "anthro Private"
  • 5. Select Videos at the top menu and create a group. Give the group the website name and add any videos related to that group.
  • 6. Select Save and submit the top link to the developers to add for videos
  • 7. To select the cover photo, upload an image that is 900x600 to photobucket and provide developers with the image link

Google Site Verification

In order to complete the site launch, the developers will need a Google Meta Tag for site verification. To do this:,

  • 1. Log into Webmaster Tools with access.
  • 2. Select or add the website you wish to verify.
  • 3. Select alternative method, and supply the developers with the HTML Tag method output
  • 4. After the developers have imported the meta tag, select Verify at the bottom to finish site verification
  • 5. *NOTE: If another google/anthro email trys to verify the site, it will not verify. Each account is given a unique Meta Goolge Tag, so that same account is the one that must check verification in the future

Google Analytics

  • 1. Open marketing@anthro.is google analytics account.
  • 2. Admin → click on drop down for account --> create new account.
  • 3. Fill in forms for name, website URL, etc. The website URL should be the finalized domain, not the Shopify url. Select Sports for the industry. Scroll down and Get Tracking ID once completed.
  • 4. Copy tracking script.
  • 5. Open Shopify account and select settings. Scroll down to the Google Analytics section and paste in the script.
  • 6. Double check that UA Tracking Number is the same on Google Analytics page and Shopify page.
  • 7. After 24 hours of launch, loginto Google Analytics and make sure that data is being grabbed.

Facebook Pixel

  • 1. Loginto Ninjas@anthro.is facebook account
  • 2. Select Anthro Interactive LLC
  • 3. Select Conversion Tracking from the side menu
  • 4. Select Checkouts as the Category, and supply the pixel name.
  • 5. Copy the generated script
  • 6. Pase the script into Shopify at General, Settings, Checkout, and additional scripts section

    • META TAGGING

    Meta tags are a crucial must for SEO and website information. Submit the meta description to the developers upon site completeion.

    FACEBOOK Refresh

    • 1. In order to refresh the information seen when posting a new athlete, visit Facebook Debugger and pase the respective url information.

    Adding A Page

    If an athlete is missing a page that exists on the master template (Richard Sherman),

    • 1. Log into Shopify and select Pages.
    • 2. Inside Pages, select Add A Page
    • 3. Give the page the correct title, and make certain to select the correct page template from the template dropdown.

    Adding Disqus

    • 1. Log into disqus using abhi's account. After logging in, you may need to click Login at the top right corner again (disqus bug).
    • 2. Select the admin panel.
    • 3. Select the dropdown located on the left hand panel, and select the option to Add A New Site.
    • 4. Fill the information for the Athlete, and select Sports as the category.
    • 5. Select the General tab located to the left.
    • 6. Scroll down and copy the shortname. Enter this into the theme settings for Shopify.

        Twitter Verification

        • 1. Log into twitter and select the settings dropdown.
        • 2. Select Widgets from the left hand menu and select Create Widget.
        • 3. Add the twitter handle for the athlete and save.
        • 4. Only select the numbers from the data-widget-id portion of the script code.
        • 5. Paste this information into the Shopify Back end for twitter ID/ twitter handle.

        Site Domain Launch

          To activate the athlete website,
        • 1. Visit the admin panel in shopify and navigate to Settings, Domain. Select Add Existing domain at the top and fill out the domain without www first.
        • 2. Read the instructions carefully. Copy the listed IP to edit the A record.
        • 3. To get the DNS records, log into netfirms (or whatever the domain registration is) and navigate to DomainCentral
        • 4. Navigate to the domain and select the domain to open its sub-menus.
        • 5. Select the option labeled DNS.
        • 6. In the Modify drop down, select the A record. From the instructions, paste in the IP address for the Points To: field for the A Record. IF the website is NOT a site transfer, delete all information in the A record except the athlete url (markuswheaton.com) and the value * (means all). Both records should point to the specified shopify IP.
        • 7. Return to the domain panel in shopify and select Done. Then select Add Existing Domain, and fill in the www portion of the url. Copy the listed url to edit the CNAME record for the DNS information.
        • 8. In the DNS dropdown, navigate the CNAME. Delete all information and only have www route to the shopify url of the athlete.
        • 9. In the Shopify Domain panel, select done. The site will now take time to populate. Revisit the domain settings in Shopify and see all options listed ask "Ok" to verify the site has completed launch.
        • 10. Once the site has been moved to our Shopify Plus account (will see a shopify plus badge in the admin panel or be notified from Christian), return to the DNS information for the CNAME records. Change the shopify url to the shopify SSL url. ie: markus-wheaton.myshopify.com --> ssl.shopify.com.

        Change MX Records to Activate Athlete Emails

        • 1. Use this link to find instructions for where the domain is registered: https://support.google.com/a/topic/1611273?hl=en&ref_topic=2683820. Our domains are usually registered with Netfirms: https://support.google.com/a/answer/174125. Select the registar and select the link that says MX record values. That link will display a table like so:
        • 2. Use the values from the table to fill in the information for the MX records in Netfirms. (Delete all records there **unless domain transfer.)
